NOV28

Mayor de Blasio Announces New Face Covering Guidance and Public Awareness Campaign to Reach Younger New Yorkers

Jul 13, 2020-Mayor de Blasio today announced that all New Yorkers should wear a face covering indoors when they are around other people

Related Links:

  • New Yorkers looking to get tested should text COVID TEST to 855-48 or visit NYC.gov/COVIDTEST

Mayor de Blasio Holds Media Availability - Monday, July 13

Mayor de Blasio Kicks Off COVID-19 Testing Day of Action to Encourage New Yorkers to Get Tested

Jul 8, 2020-With the goal of testing 150,000 New Yorkers over the next week, Mayor de Blasio today kicked off the City's COVID-19 day of action.

Related Links:

  • New Yorkers should go to nyc.gov/covidtest or text COVID TEST to 855-48 and provide your zip code to find a nearby site

Mayor de Blasio and Chancellor Carranza Announce Preliminary School Reopening Plans for Fall 2020

JULY 8, 2020-Mayor Bill de Blasio and Schools Chancellor Richard A. Carranza today announced additional preliminary plans for school reopening in September READ MORE

Related Links:

  • Health and safety will lead all planning as schools prepare for in-person and remote learning next school year

Mayor de Blasio and Taskforce on Racial Inclusion and Equity Announce Accelerated Internet Master Plan to Support Communities Hardest-Hit by COVID-19

Jul 7, 2020-Mayor de Blasio announces that the City will accelerate broadband deployment in all five boroughs, prioritizing public housing communities

Related Links:

  • Broadband deployment will connect 600,000 New Yorkers to jobs, training, education, mental health supports and healthcare resources from home

As Summer Enters Full Swing, New York City Builds "Cool Streets" Onto Nation-Leading Open Streets Program

Jul 7, 2020-Mayor Bill de Blasio today unveiled the first set of "Cool Streets" for this summer

Related Links:

  • Cool It! NYC program will expand cooling options on existing Open Streets with tree-based shade and hydrants, focusing on heat-burdened communities

Mayor de Blasio, with Support from Philanthropic Community, Announces Summer Bridge Program to Serve Thousands of New York Teens

Jul 1, 2020-Mayor de Blasio today announced SYEP Summer Bridge 2020

Related Links:

  • Mayor de Blasio today announced SYEP Summer Bridge 2020, a $51M public-private partnership that will provide constructive engagement and enrichment activities to keep 35,000 New York City youth active and productive this summer.
